intro: Palaoea, commonly known as the "false dandelion," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and a single, elongated flower head that resembles a dandelion. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, preferring well-drained soils. Palaoea species are often found in rocky or sandy habitats across parts of Africa, the Middle East, and South Asia. They are generally small, herbaceous plants with white or yellow flowers that bloom in the spring or early summer.
